title: Missing bernoulli_ on torch.cuda.ByteTensor for nn.AlphaDropout
body_html:
I just updated pytorch, tried nn.AlphaDropout module and got an error complaining on absence of bernoulli_ on a ByteTensor. Either a bug, or a type check missing, or I am doing something stupid.

import torch
nn.AlphaDropout().forward(torch.autograd.Variable(torch.zeros(2, 16, 4, 4).cuda()))
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File ".../torch/nn/modules/dropout.py", line 202, in forward
    return F.alpha_dropout(input, self.p, self.training)
  File ".../torch/nn/functional.py", line 421, in alpha_dropout
    noise.bernoulli_(p)
AttributeError: 'torch.cuda.ByteTensor' object has no attribute 'bernoulli_'

body:
I just updated pytorch, tried nn.AlphaDropout module and got an error complaining on absence of `bernoulli_` on a `ByteTensor`. Either a bug, or a type check missing, or I am doing something stupid.

```python
import torch
nn.AlphaDropout().forward(torch.autograd.Variable(torch.zeros(2, 16, 4, 4).cuda()))
```

```

  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File ".../torch/nn/modules/dropout.py", line 202, in forward
    return F.alpha_dropout(input, self.p, self.training)
  File ".../torch/nn/functional.py", line 421, in alpha_dropout
    noise.bernoulli_(p)
AttributeError: 'torch.cuda.ByteTensor' object has no attribute 'bernoulli_'
```
